350.title: Paddington bears left as tribute for Queen Elizabeth to be donated
350.article_body: Over 1,000 Paddington bears and other teddy bears left as a tribute to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be donated to a children's charity, Buckingham Palace said on Saturday. The Queen was linked to the children's literary character Paddington after they both appeared in a video together during Platinum Jubilee celebrations to mark her 70 years of service.

351.title: Alia Bhatt is fabulous performer; her ease, prep is incredible: Sidharth
351.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has called actress Alia Bhatt a fabulous performer. Earlier, Sidharth was rumoured to be dating Alia before she tied the knot. "She makes you believe that it is all coming in very easily but she does her homework. I think her ease, her prep work [is incredible]," Sidharth added. The actor will next feature in 'Thank God'.

352.title: BJP shares parody video mocking Rahul, says ‘why doesn’t suffering end mommy?’
352.article_body: BJP on Sunday shared a parody video mocking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Mommy, why doesn't this suffering end?" BJP tweeted, taking a jibe at Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi. The video touches upon several issues that Congress faced recently, including the resignation of leaders in J&K following Ghulam Nabi Azad.

353.title: Stuck for 4 yrs, Gurugram's master road to be completed in 3 months: GMDA
353.article_body: Gurugram's master road dividing Sectors 77,78 and 79 would be completed in the next three months, the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority said. The project was allotted in 2018 but work got delayed on multiple occasions. A 3.35 km-long main carriageway of the road is being constructed which will benefit over 10,000 residents living in the above sectors, officials said.

354.title: Kiara never lets stardom or the noise around get to her: Sidharth
354.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said his 'Shershaah' co-star and rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani "has great innocence" on screen and she "never lets the stardom or all the noise around get to her". "As to how she remains that simple girl is something that you can learn from her," he added. Sidharth will be next seen in Indra Kumar's 'Thank God'.

355.title: US soldiers testing Microsoft's goggles get nausea, headaches: Report
355.article_body: US soldiers testing Microsoft's new goggles for the Army suffered "mission-affecting physical impairments" including headaches and nausea, Bloomberg reported citing Pentagon's summary. One soldier reportedly said, "The devices would have gotten us killed." The defense department's testing director Nickolas Guertin said the system is "experiencing too many failures of essential functions".

356.title: There will be a few more upsets: Gibbs after SL's loss vs Namibia
356.article_body: Responding to a question on Twitter, ex-South Africa batter Herschelle Gibbs said there will be a "few more" upsets in the T20 World Cup 2022 following Sri Lanka's loss against Namibia. "Conditions in Australia...give everyone a real chance," added Gibbs in his tweet. Namibia posted a total of 163/7 with Sri Lanka bowled out for 108 in 19 overs.

357.title: There's not just SpaceX: US as startup seeks funding for Starlink in Ukraine
357.article_body: Pentagon's deputy press secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed being in touch with SpaceX after it sought funding for Starlink in Ukraine, adding, "There's not just SpaceX, there are other entities that we can...partner with when it comes to providing Ukraine with what they need on the battlefield." Earlier, SpaceX said it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine.

358.title: Rahul to vote at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in K’taka for Cong chief poll
358.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is currently in Karnataka as part of Bharat Jodo Yatra, will be voting for Congress Presidential election from a campsite in Ballari along with 40 other delegates who are a part of the yatra, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. The election for Congress party Presidential post is set to take place on Monday, October 17.

359.title: UP man kills wife & daughter, says, 'Child's face didn't match with his'
359.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his 25-year-old wife and one-year-old daughter on suspicion of infidelity in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The accused has reportedly confessed to the crime and said that "he suspected that his daughter did not belong to him as her face didn't match with his". According to police, the couple used to have frequent quarrels.

360.title: Special trains to run from Secunderabad during festive season
360.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) will run special trains from Secunderabad during the festive season. The special services include Secunderabad-Tirupati on October 19, Tirupati-Secunderabad on October 20, Secunderabad-Santragachi on October 21, Santragachi-Secunderabad on October 22 and Narsapur-Secunderabad on October 18. The trains will have 2AC, Sleeper and General Second Class coaches.

361.title: Nigerian students leave Gurugram university after fight with local students
361.article_body: A group of 50-60 Nigerian students at Gurugram's GD Goenka University have "temporarily" left their campus after some were allegedly thrashed and threatened by Indian students while playing football. Police have registered cross FIRs against each group of students for allegedly assaulting each other. Local people attacked international students with different weapons, reads one of the FIRs.

362.title: Govt to extend ₹35,000 crore to seven sectors in next PLI round: Report
362.article_body: According to an official, the government is planning to extend ₹35,000 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to seven different sectors with an aim to boost domestic manufacturing and create jobs. These sectors consist of five new sectors, toys, bicycles, leather & footwear, critical intermediates for chemicals and containers, and two existing sectors: IT hardware and pharma.

363.title: Ukraine's Kharkiv Art Museum to preserve art collection using NFTs
363.article_body: Kharkiv Art Museum (KAM) in Ukraine on October 13 said the Binance NFT market now stocks 15 works of art from the museum's Art without Borders collection. As stated in the official announcement, the earnings from the project will be used to support the museum's operations. The NFT collection will also "preserve the cultural heritage of Ukraine", the announcement added.

364.title: Congress no longer a reliable party: AIUDF leader Rafiqul Islam
364.article_body: AIUDF General Secretary Rafiqul Islam said that since the Congress is no longer reliable, his party is preparing to contest the 2024 Lok Sabha polls alone. "In the last Assembly polls, Congress' seats went up only because of AIUDF. Shortly after the elections, it ended the alliance with the AIUDF," said Islam.

365.title: 19-yr-old smashes beer bottle on policeman's head in Pune; arrested
365.article_body: A 19-year-old was arrested for smashing a beer bottle on a 52-year-old traffic policeman's head in Pune on Saturday night. The officer was trying to ease traffic near Pune's MM Chowk area when the accused approached him and started hurling abuses before hitting him with a beer bottle. The accused threatened those who tried to help the officer.

366.title: They have told the world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna: Sachin as Namibia beat SL
366.article_body: Reacting to 14th-ranked Namibia defeating Sri Lanka by 55 runs in T20 World Cup 2022 opener, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Namibia has told the cricketing world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna!" Meanwhile, Mpumelelo Mbangwa tweeted, "What a win for Namibia and what start to the ICC Men's T20 World Cup!" Namibia posted a total of 163/7 and dismissed Sri Lanka for 108.

367.title: A student asked me if it's bad to want to be rich, I said it's not a sin: Anil Agarwal
367.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Founder Anil Agarwal in a LinkedIn post revealed that he was recently asked by a student if it is a bad thing to want to be rich. "I told him, no...making money is not a sin, but once you get there...there is no harm in slowing down and giving a lift to those who are walking," Agarwal said.

368.title: It's beyond what we thought: Namibia's Frylinck after beating SL
368.article_body: Talking about Namibia's win against Sri Lanka in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022, Namibia all-rounder Jan Frylinck, who was named as the Player of the Match, said, "I'm...speechless at the moment." "What we've...achieved is above what we thought we could do," added Frylinck. Reacting to the win, Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus stated, "It's been a historic day."

369.title: Over 10,000 illegal liquor bottles crushed by road roller in Delhi
369.article_body: The Excise Department of the Delhi government on Saturday destroyed over 10,000 bottles containing 5,516 litres of smuggled liquor, officials said. The liquor bottles were spread on concrete stretches and a road roller was used to crush them, they said. "Seizure of liquor smuggled into Delhi and its destruction is a routine exercise," a senior Excise department official said.

370.title: 29-year-old TV actress Vaishali Takkar found dead at her home in Indore
370.article_body: TV actress Vaishali Takkar has passed away at the age of 29. She was found hanging at her home in Madhya Pradesh's Indore and a suicide note was also recovered from the spot, according to reports. She has acted in several Hindi shows, including 'Sasural Simar Ka', 'Super Sisters' and 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' among others.

371.title: They forced me to accept I was someone else: Noida man detained in Abu Dhabi
371.article_body: A Noida-based man named Praveen Kumar, who returned to the city after being wrongfully detained at the Abu Dhabi airport, said, "They kept me overnight, forced me to accept I was someone else." He was detained after his face matched with a 'wanted criminal' in a face recognition software. He was let go after the intervention by Indian authorities.

372.title: Amit Shah launches Hindi version of MBBS course books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal
372.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday launched the Hindi version of MBBS books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Anatomy, Physiology and Biochemistry have been chosen to be studied in Hindi as of now. "It is a big day. For the first time in the country, medical education in Hindi will begin in Madhya Pradesh," state Medical Education Minister Vishvas Sarang said.

373.title: Doesn't matter who wins, party should win: Tharoor on Cong chief poll
373.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor said it doesn't matter who wins the poll but the party should win. "Doesn't matter if Kharge sahab wins or I win. Congress should win as it's a party of inclusive India," Tharoor added. "We're the only party that wants everyone to be with us, irrespective of religion, gender, language, region...state," he stated.

374.title: Janhvi just started her journey, don't compare her & Sridevi: Boney
374.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said people shouldn't draw comparisons between Janhvi and Sridevi's work as the former has "just started her journey" as an actor. He added that Janhvi "perhaps carries" Sridevi's DNA in terms of getting into the skin of her characters. "Which is why you've seen the growth she's done in the films so far," he said about Janhvi.

375.title: You're no Deepti: Ganesh on Starc taking her name while giving mankad warning
375.article_body: Talking about a video where Mitchell Starc gave a 'mankad' warning to Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it", ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh tweeted, "You are no Deepti Sharma." "You can never be Deepti," added Ganesh in his tweet. Ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani had earlier termed Starc's gesture as "really poor" in a tweet.

376.title: Man fakes kidnapping to extort family to buy car in Delhi; arrested
376.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly faking his kidnapping to extort money from his family in Delhi as he wanted to buy a car, police said. The accused called his family and told them that some people abducted him and were asking for a ransom of ₹2 lakh, according to police. The family has filed a case against the accused.

377.title: Xi Jinping says China will not renounce right to use force over Taiwan, it responds
377.article_body: China will never renounce the right to use force to resolve the Taiwan issue but will strive for a peaceful resolution, President Xi Jinping said on Sunday. "The complete reunification of the motherland must be achieved," he added. Taiwan responded by saying that it will not back down on its sovereignty or compromise on freedom and democracy.

378.title: We got a good team, it's about the process: Dasun after loss to Namibia
378.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their 55-run defeat against Namibia in the T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "We didn't execute well with the ball. Didn't bowl in the right areas and that's a concern." He added, "We need not do anything special. We got a good team, it's about the process."

379.title: Ex-Punjab minister held for bribing officer to settle cases against him
379.article_body: Former minister Sunder Sham Arora has been arrested by the Punjab Vigilance Bureau for allegedly offering a bribe of ₹50 lakh to one of its officers to help him settle cases against him. Reports said that Arora has been facing inquiries in a disproportionate assets case and in connection with alleged irregularities during his tenure as Industries Minister.

380.title: Stopped playing lover boy 10 years ago, found it awkward: Prithviraj
380.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran said he stopped playing the role of a lover boy 10 years ago as he "was finding it awkward to do that at 30". Calling 40 a "fantastic age" for him, Prithviraj added, "I no longer have to be scared about playing a role...If being younger on screen doesn't affect me, then being older shouldn't either."

381.title: 4 persons assault woman, 2 minor daughters in Hyderabad; booked
381.article_body: Hyderabad's Humayun Nagar police have booked four people, including three members of an organisation, for allegedly assaulting a woman and her two minor daughters. The woman claimed that the accused "beat with hands, tore...clothes and touched private parts". The incident occurred when the woman went to the organisation's office after one of the accused reportedly approached her minor daughter.

382.title: Traffic movement to be regulated on Delhi roads between Oct 18-21
382.article_body: The traffic movement in Delhi will be regulated from October 18 to 21 in view of the 90th Annual General Assembly of Interpol, which is going to take place in New Delhi's Pragati Maidan next week, an official said. Delegations from 195 countries will attend the event and PM Narendra Modi will be inaugurating the Assembly on October 18.

383.title: Actress Manava says Uber driver threatened her, said 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'
383.article_body: Actress Manava Naik said that an Uber driver misbehaved with her following an argument over him jumping a signal during her ride in Mumbai. "Driver started threatening me.. 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'. He then tried to stop the uber in a dark spot...I started yelling. 2 bike riders and 1 rickshaw guy cornered the Uber...and got me out," Naik tweeted.

384.title: Warner will definitely play vs NZ, not sure about warm-up vs India: Finch
384.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has said opener David Warner is unlikely to play against India in their warm-up match on Monday in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I think Warner will definitely be right for New Zealand," added Finch. Warner suffered whiplash (a neck injury) in the second England T20I after he landed awkwardly while attempting a catch.

385.title: Basavaraj Bommai to visit Delhi to discuss cabinet expansion
385.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai confirmed that he will be going to the national capital to discuss cabinet expansion with BJP National President JP Nadda and other senior leaders. While talking to the media, the CM said that everyone will be informed when the high command gives permission for the cabinet expansion.

386.title: 12 shot dead as gunmen open fire in Mexico bar, 2nd mass shooting in less than 30 days
386.article_body: Unidentified gunmen opened fire in a bar in the central Mexican city of Irapuato on Saturday evening, shooting dead six women and six men, authorities said. Three people were injured in the attack. It is the second mass shooting in Guanajuato in less than a month as 10 people were shot dead at a bar in Tarimoro on September 21.

387.title: Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise: AAP MP
387.article_body: After Amul announced that it is increasing the prices of full cream milk and buffalo milk by ₹2 per litre, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise and breaking the common man's back." Furthermore, he said, "Average Indian families continue to pay for the mistakes of an apathetic government."

388.title: Mumbai to get ₹6,322 crore twin tunnels for East-West connectivity
388.article_body: A 4.7-km-long twin tunnel will be built below Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP), with an extended tunnel passing through the Filmcity in Goregaon as a part of Goregaon Mulund Link Road (GMLR) project. The tunnel will be constructed at the cost of ₹6,322 crore and will connect Western Express Highway with Eastern Express Highway.

389.title: Russia giving Viagra to soldiers, using rape as 'strategy' in Ukraine: UN official
389.article_body: Russia is using rape and sexual assault as a "strategy" in Ukraine, a UN official said in an interview. "When you hear women testify about Russian soldiers equipped with Viagra, it's clearly a military strategy," said UN special representative on sexual violence in conflict, Pramila Patten. UN verified over 100 rape cases in Ukraine since the war began, she added.

390.title: TN police stops suspected human sacrifice, family says ritual was to ward off evil
390.article_body: Tamil Nadu police on Saturday stopped a family of six from performing a suspected human sacrifice at their residence in Tiruvannamalai district. The neighbours reportedly alerted the police after the family did not come out for around three days. The family was performing a ritual to ward off an evil spirit, the police said.

391.title: US, Canada send armoured vehicles to Haiti to fight criminals
391.article_body: US and Canada on Saturday delivered security equipment like tactical and armoured vehicles and supplies to Haiti, according to a joint statement. "This equipment will assist the [Haitian National Police] in their fight against criminal actors who're fomenting violence and disrupting the flow of...humanitarian assistance, hindering efforts to halt the spread of cholera," the joint statement said.

392.title: 14th-ranked Namibia defeat Sri Lanka in first match of T20 World Cup 2022
392.article_body: Namibia, who're the 14th-ranked team, defeated eighth-ranked Sri Lanka by 55 runs in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022 in Geelong. Batting first, Namibia posted a total of 163/7, their highest T20I total against a full-member ICC team. Sri Lanka were bowled out for 108. It's Namibia's first-ever victory against a full-member ICC side in T20 World Cup.

393.title: Akshay shares pic of article claiming he owns '₹260cr private jet'; says 'baseless lies'
393.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Sunday called out a news website for wrongly claiming that the actor owns a private jet worth ₹260 crore. "Liar, Liar...pants on fire...Well, some people have clearly not grown up, and I'm just not in a mood to let them get away with it. Write baseless lies about me, and I'll call it out," Akshay tweeted.

394.title: ICC releases list of all commentators at T20 World Cup 2022, 3 Indians included
394.article_body: The ICC has revealed the commentary team for the T20 World Cup 2022. The official commentary team includes three Indians: Harsha Bhogle, Ravi Shastri and Sunil Gavaskar. Further, Mel Jones, Isa Guha and Natalie Germanos are the female commentators in the group of 29 commentators named for the tournament.

395.title: Manish Sisodia summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case
395.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia has been summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case on October 17. Meanwhile, the Enforcement Directorate raided about 25 locations in national capital as part of its investigation in connection with the policy. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said excise policy that was disallowed in Delhi is doing wonders in Punjab.

396.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Ananya walk the ramp as showstoppers at Lakme Fashion Week
396.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Ananya Panday walked the ramp as showstoppers at the Lakme Fashion Week on Saturday. While Sidharth walked for designer Gaurav Gupta, Ananya Panday wore an embellished blazer dress to represent designer duo Pankaj & Nidhi's 'Solaris' collection. Talking about Gaurav, Sidharth said the designer "balances edgy and masculine aesthetics" with something that looks fashionable.

397.title: Got a call saying 'hope you die': CEO after US firm fires engineers for moonlighting
397.article_body: US-based software company Canopy's CEO Davis Bell said he fired two recently hired engineers for moonlighting. He also revealed that he later got a call from someone telling him they hope Bell dies in a car crash. "[The engineers] were following a new trend of picking up a second, full-time job while lying about it to both employers," Bell said.

398.title: Rupee not sliding, Dollar strengthening incessantly: Nirmala Sitharaman in US
398.article_body: Responding to a question on Rupee's performance in the US, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she would look at it not as the Rupee sliding but as Dollar strengthening incessantly. She added, "It's a matter of fact India's Rupee probably has withstood this Dollar rate going up. I think Rupee has performed much better than many other emerging market currencies."

399.title: Govt wants to give Kashmir youth bottle of alcohol instead of job: Mufti
399.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, while criticising the administration, said that the government wants to give the youth a bottle of alcohol instead of a job in Kashmir. Opening of liquor stores won't be allowed in Kashmir, voices will be raised against it, she stated. Earlier, the J&K administration approved the sale of beer at departmental stores in urban centres.

400.title: Factually incorrect: Pak PM on Biden's 'dangerous nation' remark
400.article_body: After US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world", the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif said that the remark is "factually incorrect and misleading". He added that Pakistan has proved to be the "most responsible nuclear nation" over the past decades. Earlier, Pakistan had summoned the US ambassador over Biden's comment.
